p: The COVID-19 pandemic has drawn attention to the fact that infections are unique among medical conditions in being able to kill hundreds of thousands of people within a few months. Alas, this fact is well known to developing countries, but the current pandemic provides a tragic but timely reminder to developed countries with short memories. Infections remain the only inevitable, unpredictable, catastrophic medical threat to humankind. The idea that infections were a problem solved once and for all by Pasteurâ€™s germ theory and the advances in hygiene, serotherapy, vaccination, aseptic surgery, and anti-infectious drug treatments that followed, is incorrect, complacent, and dangerous.
